definition: wear and tear/to wear away over time
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: Yet in this new age, such attitudes are self-defeating.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在這個新時代，那種心態是自我消損。

sentences.english: And his marvelous sun was waning apparently to a black eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 而他的光輝奪目的太陽明明是在黑暗的晦蝕中消損。
